thread.title: Ike and Nembhard Named NABC All-District
thread.title_full: Ike and Nembhard Named NABC All-District

author: BVM Sportsdesk
title: Ike and Nembhard Named NABC All-District
text:
Ike and Nembhard Named NABC All-District
Gonzaga's Graham Ike and Ryan Nembhard have been named to the NABC First Team All-Pacific District, with Ike earning this honor for the second consecutive year. The selection, determined by NABC-member coaches across NCAA Division I, also follows their recent recognition as First Team All-West Coast Conference. A new alignment model for the NABC Division I districts places schools by state rather than conference, enhancing geographic representation. Ike leads the conference with a scoring average of 17.1 points per game and boasts the highest shooting percentage at 59.9%, while Nembhard set a national record with 325 assists this season.
- Graham Ike averages 17.1 points per game, ranking fourth in the conference.
- Ryan Nembhard's 325 assists make him the national leader this season.
- The NABC introduced a new Division I district structure this season, grouping teams by state.
- Both players are recognized for their consistent performance, earning All-WCC honors for the second year.
As the postseason approaches, Ike and Nembhard will aim to leverage their accolades and strong performances in the NCAA Tournament, with hopes of leading Gonzaga deep into the tournament.
Bottom LineGonzaga's standout performances from Ike and Nembhard underscore the team's strength as they head into the postseason, reflecting individual excellence and a promising shot at success in the NCAA Tournament.
Read more at Gonzaga University Athletics
